intro: Didymocheton gatopensis, commonly known as the white ghost tree, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, waxy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
